description: Borrowed from Ancient Greek ἐκβολή (ekbolḗ, “a digression”), from ἐκβάλλω (ekbállō, “to throw out”).

entries.meaning: (rhetoric, rare) A digression, (especially) one in which a person is introduced speaking his or her own words.
(music) The raising or sharping of a tone, especially (historical) in relation to Ancient Greek music.
examples: Ecbole: a  […]  change in the enharmonic genus, by the accidental elevation of a chord, or string, five dieses above its ordinary pitch.
